nodes.bodyText: I'm wondering if this should really rethrow the error. If a dataset cannot be deleted, how much of a problem is that? And the user wouldn't really be able to do anything about it, right? I'm wondering if this should just be logged at the "warn" level.

@ryanjdew I got the "{"code":500,"message":"java.io.IOException: Unable to delete directory /Users/hliu/dhf/data-sets/validArtifact.","suggestion":"Contact your server administrator."}" exception because the //data-sets does not exists or inpuFilePath does not exist. I agree with Rob and think that we do not need to throw a runtime exception here but logging it with the warning level.
